intro: Thesium reekmansii, commonly known as the New Zealand broom. It is a flowering plant native to New Zealand, characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant belongs to the family Ericaceae and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Thesium reekmansii plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for native insects and birds.
